Posts.Content: Kris10mo wrote: Hi Ladies, So I went and got my mammography records from my recent mammograms, ultrasound and biopsy.  in it I read that they are concerned about area of focal asymmetry that has changed since my mammogram last year 2012.  I just read on the internet(maybe I shouldn't do this); that a developing asymmetry has a high likelihood of malignancy is quite high between 10-15%.  So now I have myself scared again.  Why would the second radiologist send me to a surgical consult without even seeing me or doing another stereotactic biopsy? Any ladies here have focal asymmetry turn out to be benign?  I have another week to wait before I see the breast surgeon.  This waiting is killing me. Kristin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Got mammography reports: says focal asymmetry Kris10mo leaf

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2013 08:52PM Kris10mo wrote: Thank you Ladies for the information you have provided me.  I'm just so new to this that everything is scary.  Does asymmetry grow/change over time?  Is that normal with age?  Kristin
Posts.Title: Got mammography reports: says focal asymmetry Kris10mo leaf

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2013 05:15PM Kris10mo wrote: Star13, Hi.  I'm new to the board too.  I am 44 and also just got a Birad4 from a recent mammogram.  I had additional films done and an ultrasound.  Then it was recommended that I have a stereo biopsy.  I had it done on 11/21/13.  The test itself was not at all painful to me.  I was very nervous and anxious obviously but refrained from taking a Zanax as I too wanted to be alert and able to focus on what was going on.  I was in table for 45 minutes I think, most of that time for positioning and repositioning.  The actual needle extraction was very quick and did not hurt.  I don't know enough about my own situation to have any advice for you...just know I'm thinking of you and sending you best wishes. Kristin
Posts.Title: Birad4 Star13 Star13

Posts.Content: Dec 8, 2013 10:50PM Kris10mo wrote: Hello, I understand your frustration and concern.  I just had a stereotatic biopsy done on 11/21/13 and I got a pathology report back saying they did not biopsy the right area and the clip that is now in my breast is a few cm away from the suspicious area.  I was not told after the procedure that they had taken samples from the wrong area...which surely they would have seen from the mammo done immediately after the biopsy. I have been told that it is not uncommon to have a biopsy come back without definitive answers, but that does not help the way that I feel.  I too have had to wait for three weeks after the first biopsy to have a consult with a surgeon (at a totally new facility). The biopsy that was done in the wrong area came back B9 and I was told be the facility that I could not have another stereotactic done there as the table they use(which is brought in to the hospital every two weeks) will not accommodate the location that I need to have the second biopsy to be completed. I'm waiting to see what happens at the surgical consult to see what my situation is before I consider action against this small hospital. My thoughts are with you. Kristin
Posts.Title: They biopsied the wrong place Librarian Optimistictraveler
